title: Melbourne Grammar a Bartlett family affair
text:
Roy Kelley is stepping down as Melbourne Grammar School's headmaster after 10 years. Chris Hopkins

There are no politics quite as compelling as private school politics, especially in that gossipy village John Batman gave us: Melbourne. Who could forget the Louise Adler/Rosa Storelli conflagration at Methodist Ladies College in 2012?

At Melbourne Grammar School Roy Kelley is concluding his decade as headmaster, to be succeeded next year by Philip Grutzner – in 161 years, the first alumnus ever to lead it.

The school council (which hires and fires the principal), as you might imagine, is veritably groaning with accomplishment. It includes cardiothoracic surgeon Julian Smith, paediatrician Amanda Day and particle physicist Geoffrey Taylor, tax silk Philip Solomon, former mining boss Andrew Michelmore and Flagstaff Partners’ Geoff Cohen. Its chairman is former institutional broker, now SG Hiscock director, Michael Bartlett.

At a school assembly on Monday, Kelley announced that next year’s school captain will be none other than Tom Bartlett. Yes, the chairman’s deserving son, a standout leader among nearly 200 men.

This time three years ago, there arose no small degree of consternation among the school’s long-suffering parents when Kelley announced that Nick Bartlett, another meritorious heir of the chairman, would be 2017 school captain. Sheer, rancid jealousy! Better yet, Nick’s vice captain also happened to be his twin brother, Richard Bartlett. True story.
description: Melbourne Grammar School's council has appointed a new headmaster, and the old headmaster has appointed a new school captain...
